meanings.definition: Showing a lack of courage or confidence; easily frightened
meanings.sent1: The timid puppy cowered in the corner during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She felt timid about speaking up in front of the large audience.
meanings.sent3: The timid squirrel hesitated before attempting to steal a nut from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His timid approach to negotiations left him at a disadvantage.
meanings.sent5: The timid child clung to their parent's hand, afraid of the unfamiliar surroundings.

meanings.sent1: The timid student hesitated to raise their hand in class.
meanings.sent2: Her timid response to the challenge showed her lack of confidence.
meanings.sent3: The timid explorer turned back at the first sign of danger.
meanings.sent4: His timid decision-making led to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The timid kitten stayed hidden under the bed, unsure of venturing out.

meanings.sent1: The timid girl blushed when complimented on her artwork.
meanings.sent2: He was too timid to ask his crush to the school dance.
meanings.sent3: The timid deer cautiously approached the watering hole.
meanings.sent4: Her timid smile revealed her nervousness in social situations.
meanings.sent5: The timid student avoided eye contact with the teacher during the presentation.
